"""
Scaling law discovery for LLM fine-tuning scenarios
Extended log–quadratic power‐law model fitted via closed‐form ridge regression in log space.
Features: [lr, bsz, data_size, non_embedding_param_size] → loss
Model form:
   log(loss) ≈ θ₀ 
              + Σᵢ θᵢ · log(xᵢ) 
              + Σᵢ φᵢ · (log(xᵢ))²
Total parameters: 1 intercept + 4 linear + 4 quadratic = 9
"""
import numpy as np

def scaling_law_func(data_points, params):
    """
    Predict lm loss given hyperparameters and learned params.
    data_points: (N,4) array [lr, bsz, data_size, non_embedding_param_size]
    params:      (9,) or (T,9) array [θ₀, θ₁…θ₄, φ₁…φ₄]
    Returns:     (N,) or (N,T) array of predicted losses
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))  # (N,4)
    # ensure strictly positive to take logs
    eps = 1e-12
    X = np.clip(X, eps, None)
    # form log‐features
    logX = np.log(X)                                         # (N,4)
    # build design matrix [1, logX1…logX4, (logX1)^2…(logX4)^2]
    N, F = logX.shape                                         # F should be 4
    quad = logX**2                                            # (N,4)
    design = np.concatenate([np.ones((N,1)), logX, quad], axis=1)  # (N,9)

    # handle param shapes
    p = np.asarray(params, dtype=float)
    if p.ndim == 1:
        p = p[None, :]                                        # (1,9)
    T, P = p.shape
    assert P == design.shape[1], f"Expected params of length {design.shape[1]}, got {P}"
    # compute log‐predictions and exponentiate
    log_preds = design @ p.T                                 # (N,T)
    preds = np.exp(log_preds)
    return preds[:,0] if T == 1 else preds                   # (N,) or (N,T)


def fit_scaling_law(data_points, loss_values):
    """
    Fit the log–quadratic scaling law via ridge regression in log space:
      log(loss) = θ₀ 
                  + Σᵢ θᵢ · log(xᵢ) 
                  + Σᵢ φᵢ · (log(xᵢ))²
    Returns params: (9,) array [θ₀, θ₁…θ₄, φ₁…φ₄]
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))  # (N,4)
    y = np.asarray(loss_values, dtype=float)                 # (N,) or (N,1)

    # ensure strictly positive for logs
    eps = 1e-12
    X = np.clip(X, eps, None)
    y = np.clip(y, eps, None).reshape(-1)                     # flatten to (N,)

    # build design matrix same as in scaling_law_func
    logX = np.log(X)                                         # (N,4)
    quad = logX**2                                            # (N,4)
    N, F = logX.shape                                         # F == 4
    design = np.concatenate([np.ones((N,1)), logX, quad], axis=1)  # (N,9)

    # target is log(loss)
    t = np.log(y)                                             # (N,)

    # ridge parameter scaled to data magnitude for stability
    P = design.shape[1]                                       # 9
    # raw XtX for trace
    XtX_raw = design.T @ design
    ridge = 1e-6 * np.trace(XtX_raw) / P
    # solve (XᵀX + ridge·I) θ = Xᵀ t
    A = XtX_raw + ridge * np.eye(P)
    b = design.T @ t                                          # (9,)
    theta = np.linalg.solve(A, b)                             # (9,)

    return theta

    p = np.asarray(params, dtype=float)
    if p.ndim == 1:
        p = p[None, :]                                      # (1,5)
    T, P = p.shape
    assert P == X.shape[1] + 1, f"Expected params of length {X.shape[1]+1}, got {P}"
    # compute log-features
    logX = np.log(X)                                       # (N,4)
    # θ₀ + ∑ θᵢ·logX[:,i]

    coefs = p[:, 1:]                                       # (T,4)
    # log_preds: (N,T)

      log(loss) = θ₀ + θ₁·log(lr) + θ₂·log(bsz)
                  + θ₃·log(data_size) + θ₄·log(param_size)
    via ordinary least squares in log space (with tiny ridge for stability).
    Returns params: (5,) array [θ₀…θ₄]
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))  # (N,4)
    y = np.asarray(loss_values, dtype=float)
    # flatten y to 2D
    if y.ndim == 1:
        y2d = y[:, None]                                      # (N,1)
    else:
        y2d = y
    N, F = X.shape
    T = y2d.shape[1]
    # ensure strictly positive for log
    eps = 1e-12
    X = np.clip(X, eps, None)
    y2d = np.clip(y2d, eps, None)
    # build design matrix in log space: [1, log(x1), ..., log(xF)]
    logX = np.log(X)                                        # (N,F)
    X_design = np.concatenate([np.ones((N, 1)), logX], axis=1)  # (N, F+1)
    P = F + 1
    # tiny ridge regularization for numerical stability
    ridge = 1e-8
    XtX = X_design.T @ X_design + ridge * np.eye(P)         # (P,P)
    Xty = X_design.T @ np.log(y2d)                          # (P,T)
    # solve for θ in each target column
    thetas = np.linalg.solve(XtX, Xty)                      # (P,T)
    # return shape (P,) if single target else (T,P)
    if T == 1:
        return thetas[:, 0]
    else:
        return thetas.T
